definitions.definition: A round fruit with red, green, or yellow skin and sweet white flesh.
definitions.example: She ate a red apple for lunch.

definitions.definition: A long curved yellow fruit with soft sweet flesh.
definitions.example: The monkey loves to eat bananas.

definitions.definition: A sweet juicy tropical fruit with yellow or orange flesh.
definitions.example: The mango is ripe and delicious.

definitions.definition: A small furry animal kept as a pet that meows.
definitions.example: The cat sat on the mat.

definitions.definition: A common animal kept as a pet that barks and wags its tail.
definitions.example: The dog ran to fetch the ball.

definitions.definition: An animal with wings and feathers that can usually fly.
definitions.example: The bird sang a beautiful song.

definitions.definition: An animal that lives in water and breathes through gills.
definitions.example: The fish swam in the pond.

definitions.definition: The largest land animal, with a long trunk and big ears.
definitions.example: The elephant sprayed water with its trunk.

definitions.definition: A large wild cat with a mane, known as the king of the jungle.
definitions.example: The lion roared loudly.

definitions.definition: A large wild cat with orange fur and black stripes.
definitions.example: The tiger ran through the forest.

definitions.definition: A large farm animal that gives milk.
definitions.example: The cow ate grass in the field.

definitions.definition: A large strong animal with four legs used for riding.
definitions.example: The horse galloped across the field.

definitions.definition: A small to medium-sized animal that climbs trees and has a tail.
definitions.example: The monkey swung from branch to branch.

definitions.definition: A small furry animal with long ears that hops.
definitions.example: The white rabbit hopped in the garden.

definitions.definition: A bird that lives near water and can swim and fly.
definitions.example: The duck swam in the pond.

definitions.definition: A beautiful insect with large colourful wings.
definitions.example: The butterfly landed on the flower.

definitions.definition: A small flying insect that makes honey and can sting.
definitions.example: The bee buzzed around the flowers.

definitions.definition: Having the colour of blood or a ripe tomato.
definitions.example: She wore a red dress.

definitions.definition: Having the colour of a clear sky or the sea.
definitions.example: He painted the sky blue.

definitions.definition: Having the colour of grass or leaves.
definitions.example: The grass is green in the park.

definitions.definition: Having the colour of the sun or a ripe lemon.
definitions.example: The sunflower is bright yellow.

definitions.definition: A round citrus fruit with orange-coloured skin and sweet flesh.
definitions.example: She drank a glass of orange juice.

definitions.definition: Having the colour between red and yellow.
definitions.example: The sunset turned the sky orange.

definitions.definition: Having a colour that is a mix of red and blue.
definitions.example: She painted her room purple.

definitions.definition: Having a light red colour.
definitions.example: She wore a pink shirt.

definitions.definition: Having the darkest colour, like the night sky.
definitions.example: He has a black dog.

definitions.definition: Having the lightest colour, like snow or milk.
definitions.example: The snow is white and cold.

definitions.definition: Having the colour of chocolate or earth.
definitions.example: The bear has brown fur.

definitions.definition: The star at the centre of our solar system that gives us light and heat.
definitions.example: The sun rises in the east every morning.

definitions.definition: The natural satellite of the Earth that shines at night.
definitions.example: The full moon lit up the night sky.

definitions.definition: A ball of hot glowing gas far away in space that shines at night.
definitions.example: We counted the stars in the sky.

definitions.definition: A tall plant with a trunk, branches, and leaves.
definitions.example: The children played under the big tree.

definitions.definition: The colourful part of a plant that attracts bees and butterflies.
definitions.example: She picked a beautiful flower.

definitions.definition: Water that falls from clouds in the sky.
definitions.example: The rain made the garden wet.

definitions.definition: A white or grey mass of water droplets floating in the sky.
definitions.example: The clouds covered the sun.

definitions.definition: A large natural stream of water that flows to the sea.
definitions.example: They swam in the cool river.

definitions.definition: A very high hill made of rock.
definitions.example: We climbed to the top of the mountain.

definitions.definition: The large body of salt water that covers most of the Earth.
definitions.example: The ship sailed across the ocean.

definitions.definition: A woman who has given birth to a child; a female parent.
definitions.example: My mother makes the best food.

definitions.definition: A man who has a child; a male parent.
definitions.example: My father reads me stories at night.

definitions.definition: A boy or man who has the same parents as you.
definitions.example: My brother plays cricket with me.

definitions.definition: A girl or woman who has the same parents as you.
definitions.example: My sister and I share a room.

definitions.definition: A very young child who cannot yet walk or talk.
definitions.example: The baby smiled at her mother.

definitions.definition: The mother of your mother or father.
definitions.example: My grandmother tells wonderful stories.

definitions.definition: The father of your mother or father.
definitions.example: My grandfather teaches me chess.

definitions.definition: The organ in your face that you use for seeing.
definitions.example: She has bright green eyes.

definitions.definition: The organ on the side of your head that you use for hearing.
definitions.example: He covered his ears when the music was too loud.

definitions.definition: The part of your face used for smelling and breathing.
definitions.example: He has a small button nose.

definitions.definition: The opening in your face used for eating and speaking.
definitions.example: Open your mouth and say 'ahh'.

definitions.definition: The part of your body at the end of your arm with five fingers.
definitions.example: She waved her hand to say hello.

definitions.definition: The part at the bottom of your leg that you use for walking.
definitions.example: He hurt his foot playing football.

definitions.definition: The part of your body above your neck where your brain is.
definitions.example: She nodded her head to say yes.

definitions.definition: A set of written or printed pages bound together.
definitions.example: She read a book before bed.

definitions.definition: A place where children go to learn.
definitions.example: She loves going to school every day.

definitions.definition: A person who teaches students in a school.
definitions.example: The teacher explained the math problem.

definitions.definition: A thin stick used for writing or drawing, made of wood with a graphite centre.
definitions.example: She sharpened her pencil before the test.

definitions.definition: The clear liquid that fills rivers, lakes and oceans and that all living things need to survive.
definitions.example: She drank a glass of cold water.

definitions.definition: Things you eat to stay alive and healthy.
definitions.example: We need to buy food at the market.

definitions.definition: The white liquid produced by cows and other animals that humans drink.
definitions.example: He drinks a glass of milk every morning.

definitions.definition: A baked food made from flour, water and yeast.
definitions.example: She ate bread and butter for breakfast.

definitions.definition: Small white or brown grains that are cooked and eaten as food.
definitions.example: We had rice and vegetables for dinner.

definitions.definition: An oval object laid by female birds and used as food.
definitions.example: She boiled an egg for breakfast.

definitions.definition: A building where people live.
definitions.example: Their house has a garden in front.

definitions.definition: A hinged or sliding barrier used to close an entrance.
definitions.example: Please close the door when you leave.

definitions.definition: An opening in a wall or roof, covered with glass, that lets in light.
definitions.example: She looked out the window at the rain.

definitions.definition: A seat with a back and four legs for one person.
definitions.example: He sat on the chair and read his book.

definitions.definition: A piece of furniture with a flat top and legs, used for eating or working.
definitions.example: We eat dinner at the table every evening.

definitions.definition: A round object used in sports and games.
definitions.example: He kicked the ball into the goal.

definitions.definition: An activity you play for fun, often with rules.
definitions.example: We played a fun board game.

definitions.definition: An object made for children to play with.
definitions.example: She got a new toy on her birthday.

definitions.definition: To put food in your mouth, chew it, and swallow it.
definitions.example: We eat lunch at noon.

definitions.definition: To take liquid into your mouth and swallow it.
definitions.example: He likes to drink orange juice.

definitions.definition: To rest with your eyes closed and your mind and body inactive.
definitions.example: She sleeps for eight hours every night.

definitions.definition: To move quickly on your feet.
definitions.example: The children run in the park every day.

definitions.definition: To push yourself up into the air with your legs.
definitions.example: The frog can jump very high.

definitions.definition: To take part in a game or other enjoyable activity.
definitions.example: The children play outside after school.

definitions.definition: To look at written words and understand them.
definitions.example: She reads a book every night before bed.

definitions.definition: To make letters or words on paper using a pen or pencil.
definitions.example: He writes neatly in his notebook.

definitions.definition: To make musical sounds with your voice.
definitions.example: She loves to sing in the shower.

definitions.definition: To move your body in a rhythmic way, usually to music.
definitions.example: They danced at the school party.

definitions.definition: To make sounds showing that you find something funny.
definitions.example: The children laughed at the funny clown.

definitions.definition: To shed tears because you feel sad or hurt.
definitions.example: The baby cried when she was hungry.

definitions.definition: To do something useful for someone.
definitions.example: She helped her friend carry the bags.

definitions.definition: To get new knowledge or skill through study or experience.
definitions.example: She learns five new words every day.

definitions.definition: A strong warm feeling of caring deeply about someone or something.
definitions.example: The love between a mother and child is very special.

definitions.definition: To have a strong warm feeling of caring about someone.
definitions.example: I love my family very much.

definitions.definition: A person you like and enjoy spending time with.
definitions.example: She is my best friend at school.

definitions.definition: Feeling or showing pleasure and contentment.
definitions.example: She was happy when she got the gift.

definitions.definition: Feeling unhappy or having low spirits.
definitions.example: He was sad when his friend moved away.

definitions.definition: Large in size or amount.
definitions.example: The elephant is a very big animal.

definitions.definition: Not large in size or amount; little.
definitions.example: The small mouse hid under the chair.

definitions.definition: Moving or able to move quickly.
definitions.example: The cheetah is the fastest animal.

definitions.definition: Not moving or happening quickly.
definitions.example: The turtle walks at a slow pace.

definitions.definition: Having a high temperature; very warm.
definitions.example: Be careful, the soup is very hot.

definitions.definition: Having a low temperature; not warm.
definitions.example: She wore a coat because it was cold outside.

definitions.definition: Having the right or desired qualities; of a high standard.
definitions.example: She is a good student who always tries her best.

definitions.definition: Very pleasing to look at or listen to.
definitions.example: The sunset was beautiful.

definitions.definition: Free from dirt or marks.
definitions.example: She washed her hands to keep them clean.

definitions.definition: The number 1; a single unit.
definitions.example: I have one brother and one sister.

definitions.definition: The number 2; one more than one.
definitions.example: She has two cats.

definitions.definition: The number 3.
definitions.example: He ate three cookies.

definitions.definition: The number 4.
definitions.example: A car has four wheels.

definitions.definition: The number 5.
definitions.example: She has five fingers on each hand.

definitions.definition: The number 6.
definitions.example: There are six eggs in the box.

definitions.definition: The number 7.
definitions.example: A week has seven days.

definitions.definition: The number 8.
definitions.example: An octopus has eight arms.

definitions.definition: The number 9.
definitions.example: There are nine planets in our solar system.

definitions.definition: The number 10.
definitions.example: She has ten toes.

definitions.definition: The space above the Earth where we can see clouds, the sun, and stars.
definitions.example: The sky is blue and clear today.

definitions.definition: A green plant with narrow leaves that covers the ground in parks and gardens.
definitions.example: We sat on the green grass in the park.

definitions.definition: Tiny grains of rock found on beaches and in deserts.
definitions.example: We built a sandcastle on the beach.

definitions.definition: Air that moves across the Earth's surface.
definitions.example: The wind blew the leaves off the tree.

definitions.definition: The heat and light produced when something burns.
definitions.example: They sat around the fire to keep warm.

definitions.definition: Frozen water that is hard and cold.
definitions.example: She added ice to her drink.

definitions.definition: A baked food made from flour, water and yeast.
definitions.example: She ate bread and butter for breakfast.

definitions.definition: Having a pleasant taste like sugar.
definitions.example: This cake is very sweet.

definitions.definition: Smooth and gentle to touch; not hard or rough.
definitions.example: The kitten's fur is very soft.

definitions.definition: Solid and firm; not soft or easy to bend.
definitions.example: The rock was hard and heavy.

definitions.definition: The energy from the sun or a lamp that lets you see.
definitions.example: She turned on the light in the dark room.

definitions.definition: Not heavy; easy to lift.
definitions.example: The bag is light enough for a child to carry.

definitions.definition: Without much light; not bright.
definitions.example: It was dark outside after sunset.

definitions.definition: The time between sunrise and sunset when it is light.
definitions.example: We spent the whole day at the beach.

definitions.definition: The time between sunset and sunrise when it is dark.
definitions.example: The stars shine at night.

definitions.definition: The early part of the day before noon.
definitions.example: We had breakfast in the morning.

definitions.definition: The time at the end of the day before night.
definitions.example: We played in the garden in the evening.

definitions.definition: The quality of something that you see, like red, blue, or green.
definitions.example: What is your favourite colour?

definitions.definition: The outline or form of something like a circle or square.
definitions.example: Can you name the shape of that sign?

definitions.definition: A round flat shape, like a ring or a coin.
definitions.example: Draw a circle on the paper.

definitions.definition: A shape with four equal sides and four right angles.
definitions.example: The window is shaped like a square.

definitions.definition: A shape with three straight sides and three corners.
definitions.example: A pizza slice is shaped like a triangle.

definitions.definition: A mathematical symbol used to count or measure things.
definitions.example: Can you write the number 5 on the board?

definitions.definition: A written symbol that represents a sound in a language, like A, B, or C.
definitions.example: The first letter of the alphabet is A.

definitions.definition: A unit of language that has meaning and can be spoken or written.
definitions.example: Can you spell this word for me?

definitions.definition: A description of imaginary or real events, told for enjoyment.
definitions.example: Mum reads me a bedtime story every night.

definitions.definition: Sounds arranged in a pleasant or interesting way, often with a beat or melody.
definitions.example: She loves listening to music.

definitions.definition: Creative work like painting or drawing made to be enjoyed.
definitions.example: She drew a beautiful picture in art class.

definitions.definition: An active game or activity with rules, done for exercise or fun.
definitions.example: His favourite sport is cricket.

definitions.definition: A vehicle with two wheels that you ride by pedalling.
definitions.example: She rides her bicycle to school.

definitions.definition: A vehicle with four wheels and an engine, used for travel on roads.
definitions.example: Dad drove the car to the supermarket.

definitions.definition: A small vehicle used to travel on water.
definitions.example: They took a boat across the lake.

definitions.definition: A line of railway carriages pulled by an engine.
definitions.example: We travelled to the city by train.

definitions.definition: A flying vehicle with wings and an engine.
definitions.example: They flew to the holiday in a plane.

definitions.definition: To use your mind to consider something.
definitions.example: Think before you answer the question.

definitions.definition: To have information or facts about something in your mind.
definitions.example: Do you know the answer?

definitions.definition: To notice something using your eyes.
definitions.example: Can you see the bird in the tree?

definitions.definition: To sense sounds using your ears.
definitions.example: Can you hear the music playing?

definitions.definition: To put your hand or fingers on something.
definitions.example: Don't touch the hot stove.

definitions.definition: To sense an odour using your nose.
definitions.example: Can you smell the flowers?

definitions.definition: To become bigger over time.
definitions.example: Plants grow when you water them.

definitions.definition: Friendly and generous; caring about others.
definitions.example: It was kind of you to share your lunch.

definitions.definition: Willing to do things that are scary or difficult; not afraid.
definitions.example: The brave firefighter rescued the cat.

definitions.definition: Clever and quick to learn; intelligent.
definitions.example: She is a very smart student.

definitions.definition: Having great physical power or force.
definitions.example: He is strong enough to lift a heavy box.

definitions.definition: In good physical condition; not ill.
definitions.example: Eating vegetables keeps you healthy.

definitions.definition: A sentence that asks for information or an answer.
definitions.example: She asked a question in class.

definitions.definition: A response given to a question.
definitions.example: She gave the right answer in the quiz.

definitions.definition: An image made by drawing, painting, or photography.
definitions.example: He drew a picture of his family.

definitions.definition: The quality of something that produces a visual sensation, like red or blue.
definitions.example: What is your favourite colour?

definitions.definition: Sound arranged into patterns of rhythm and melody to create art.
definitions.example: She played music on her flute.

definitions.definition: Images and thoughts that appear in your mind when you sleep.
definitions.example: I had a happy dream about flying.

definitions.definition: To experience thoughts and images during sleep.
definitions.example: She dreams about being an astronaut.

definitions.definition: To give part of something to others.
definitions.example: Please share your crayons with your classmate.

definitions.definition: A group of people related to each other, like parents and children.
definitions.example: We spend weekends with our family.

definitions.definition: The place where you live with your family.
definitions.example: After school, she went straight home.

definitions.definition: The natural world including plants, animals, rivers, and mountains.
definitions.example: We love to walk in nature.

definitions.definition: The planet we live on; also the soil in the ground.
definitions.example: The Earth goes around the Sun.

definitions.definition: The invisible gas that surrounds the Earth and that we breathe.
definitions.example: We cannot live without air.
